verses.verse: To the <S%H5329>chief<s%> <S%H5329>Musician<s%> upon <S%H1665>Gittith,<s%> A Psalm of <S%H623>Asaph.<s%> <S%H7442>Sing<s%> <S%H7442>aloud<s%> to <S%H430>God<s%> our <S%H5797>strength:<s%> make a joyful noise to the <S%H430>God<s%> of <S%H3290>Jacob.<s%>
<S%H5375>Take<s%> a <S%H2172>psalm,<s%> and <S%H5414>bring<s%> here the <S%H8596>tambourine,<s%> the <S%H5273>pleasant<s%> <S%H3658>harp<s%> with the <S%H5035>psaltery.<s%>
<S%H8628>Blow<s%> up the <S%H7782>trumpet<s%> in the <S%H2320>new<s%> <S%H2320>moon,<s%> in the time <S%H3677>appointed,<s%> on our <S%H2282>solemn<s%> <S%H2282>feast<s%> <S%H3117>day.<s%>
For <S%H1931>this<s%> was a <S%H2706>statute<s%> for <S%H3478>Israel,<s%> and a <S%H4941>law<s%> of the <S%H430>God<s%> of <S%H3290>Jacob.<s%>

This he <S%H7760>ordained<s%> in <S%H3084>Joseph<s%> for a <S%H5715>testimony,<s%> when he <S%H3318>went<s%> out <S%H5921>through<s%> the <S%H776>land<s%> of <S%H4714>Egypt:<s%> where I <S%H8085>heard<s%> a <S%H8193>language<s%> that I <S%H3045>understood<s%> not.
I <S%H5493>removed<s%> his <S%H7926>shoulder<s%> from the <S%H5449>burden:<s%> his <S%H3709>hands<s%> were <S%H5674>delivered<s%> from the <S%H1731>pots.<s%>

You <S%H7121>called<s%> in <S%H6869>trouble,<s%> and I <S%H2502>delivered<s%> you; I <S%H6030>answered<s%> you in the <S%H5643>secret<s%> place of <S%H7482>thunder:<s%> I <S%H974>proved<s%> you <S%H5291>at<s%> the <S%H4325>waters<s%> of <S%H4809>Meribah.<s%> <S%H5542>Selah.<s%>
<S%H8085>Hear,<s%> O my <S%H5971>people,<s%> and I will <S%H5749>testify<s%> to you: O <S%H3478>Israel,<s%> <S%H518>if<s%> you will <S%H8085>listen<s%> to me;
There shall <S%H3808>no<s%> <S%H2114>strange<s%> <S%H410>god<s%> be in you; <S%H3808>neither<s%> shall you <S%H7812>worship<s%> any <S%H5236>strange<s%> <S%H410>god.<s%>

I am the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> your <S%H430>God,<s%> which <S%H5927>brought<s%> you out of the <S%H776>land<s%> of <S%H4714>Egypt:<s%> open your <S%H6310>mouth<s%> <S%H7337>wide,<s%> and I will <S%H4390>fill<s%> it.
But my <S%H5971>people<s%> would not <S%H8085>listen<s%> to my <S%H6963>voice;<s%> and <S%H3478>Israel<s%> <S%H14>would<s%> <S%H3808>none<s%> of me.
So I <S%H7971>gave<s%> them up to their own <S%H3820>hearts'<s%> <S%H8307>lust:<s%> and they <S%H3212>walked<s%> in their own <S%H4156>counsels.<s%>
<S%H3863>Oh<s%> that my <S%H5971>people<s%> had <S%H8085>listened<s%> to me, and <S%H3478>Israel<s%> had <S%H1980>walked<s%> in my <S%H1870>ways!<s%>
I should <S%H4592>soon<s%> have <S%H3665>subdued<s%> their <S%H341>enemies,<s%> and <S%H7725>turned<s%> my <S%H3027>hand<s%> <S%H5921>against<s%> their <S%H6862>adversaries.<s%>
The <S%H8130>haters<s%> of the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> should have <S%H3584>submitted<s%> themselves to him: but their <S%H6256>time<s%> should have <S%H1961>endured<s%> for <S%H5769>ever.<s%>
He should have <S%H398>fed<s%> them also with the <S%H2459>finest<s%> of the <S%H2406>wheat:<s%> and with <S%H1706>honey<s%> out of the <S%H6697>rock<s%> should I have <S%H7649>satisfied<s%> you.
